answerText: Brown [accept Helen Gurley Brown or Rita Mae Brown][10] Louise Mallard feels liberated when she hears of her husband's death in this author's "The Story of an Hour." She also wrote The Awakening, which is considered an early feminist novel.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | Editors Round 7 | 20 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Answer the following about American feminist literature, for 10 points each. [10] The author of Sex and the Single Girl, who was also the editor-in-chief of Cosmopolitan for over 30 years, has this last name. An author named Rita Mae with this last name wrote the lesbian novel Rubyfruit Jungle.
